Friends

class CodecConfig

Detailed Description

Central instance of the codec device. It allows to access and to make use of the functionality provided by the VideoEncoder, VideoDecoder and AudioDecoder sub-class instances.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CodecManager::~CodecManager (   )  [virtual]
 

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

CodecDevice::ResultType CodecManager::ObtainDecoder (  CodecDevice *&  codec_device,
CodecDevice::CodecType  codec_type,
BOOLEAN &  combined_device
) 
 

Retrieves a pointer to an instance of a decoder (CodecDevice sub-class). This pointer has to be casted to the actual codec device type pointer (e.g. VideoDecoder) in order to use the provided functionality.

Parameters:
codec_device On return it contains the pointer to a CodecDevice sub-class instance. Via this pointer the decoder functionality can be accessed. In case of failure it contains a null pointer.
codec_type Required decoder codec to be supported by the returned CodecDevice instance.
enc_info On return, it specifies if the obtained decoder is a combined device i.e. a decoder/renderer.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an aprropriate error code.
See also:
ReleaseDecoder

CodecDevice::ResultType CodecManager::ObtainEncoder (  CodecDevice *&  codec_device,
CodecDevice::CodecType  codec_type,
BOOLEAN &  combined_device
) 
 

Retrieves a pointer to an instance of an encoder (CodecDevice sub-class). This pointer has to be casted to the actual codec device type pointer (e.g. VideoEncoder) in order to use the provided functionality.

Parameters:
codec_device On return it contains the pointer to a CodecDevice sub-class instance. Via this pointer the encoder functionality can be accessed. In case of failure it contains a null pointer.
codec_type Required encoder codec to be supported by the returned CodecDevice instance.
enc_info On return, it specifies if the obtained encoder is a combined device i.e. a capturer/encoder.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an aprropriate error code.
See also:
ReleaseEncoder

CodecDevice::ResultType CodecManager::RegisterDecoder (  CodecDevice *  codec_device  ) 
 

This function is used by a codec library in order to register a new decoder with the CodecManager (Note: one decoder can support more than one codec). This registers an already created instance of the CodecDevice sub-class.

Parameters:
codec_device Pointer to the decoder that shall be registered.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

CodecDevice::ResultType CodecManager::RegisterEncoder (  CodecDevice *  codec_device  ) 
 

This function is used by a codec library in order to register a new encoder with the CodecManager (Note: one encoder can support more than one codec). This registers an already created instance of the CodecDevice sub-class.

Parameters:
codec_device Pointer to the encoder that shall be registered.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

void CodecManager::ReleaseDecoder (  CodecDevice *  codec_device  ) 
 

Releases a previously obtained encoder (obtained by CodecManager::ObtainDecoder). This method should be invoked as soon as the decoder is not needed anymore to allow other decoders to access the resources.

Parameters:
codec_device Pointer to the CodecDevice (sub-class) instance that shall be released.
See also:
ObtainDecoder

void CodecManager::ReleaseEncoder (  CodecDevice *  codec_device  ) 
 

Releases a previously obtained encoder (obtained by CodecManager::ObtainEncoder. This method should be invoked as soon as the encoder is not needed anymore to allow other encoders to access the resources.

Parameters:
codec_device Pointer to the CodecDevice (sub-class) instance that shall be released.
See also:
ObtainEncoder

void CodecManager::UnregisterDecoder (  CodecDevice *  codec_device  ) 
 

Unregister a decoder sub-class.

Parameters:
codec_device Pointer to the decoder that shall be unregistered.

void CodecManager::UnregisterEncoder (  CodecDevice *  codec_device  ) 
 

Unregister an encoder sub-class.

Parameters:
codec_device Pointer to the encoder that shall be unregistered.
